Key Arguments: The legislation threatens freedom of speech in Australia.
It centralizes the power to determine 'truth' to a small group, which is historically problematic.
The bill could punish individuals or companies for not aligning with government opinions.
Media companies would face uncertainty about what the government considers misinformation or disinformation.
The government is exempt from the rules, allowing it to disseminate untruthful information without penalty.
The bill is seen as a step towards a repressive state.
Notable Quotes: It will give power to determine 'Truth' of information to a small group of people.
This new Bill will result in the punishment of people or companies who do not support the opinions of the government of the day.
Interesting to note that the government itself is Exempt from its own rule.
